modules package

Submodules

modules.FK module

Module contains functions to calculate forward kinematics

modules.FK.fk_dh(theta1: float, theta2: float, theta3: float, theta4: float, eff: list)

Function calculate forward kinematics of the robotic arm with given parameters and specified length of robotic arm links. Forward kinematics is being calculated using Denavit–Hartenberg notation.

Parameters

  • theta1 – Base rotation angle

  • theta2 – 1st link rotation angle

  • theta3 – 2nd link rotation angle

  • theta4 – 3rd link rotation angle

  • eff – End effector dimensions

Returns

alpha; xyz_pos_link3; xyz_pos_link2; xyz_pos_link1; status: Orientation and list of xyz positions of each link end

modules.IK module

Module contains functions to calculate inverse kinematics

modules.IK.ik_geo(px: int, py: int, pz: int, alfa: int, eff: list)

Function calculate inverse kinematics of the robotic arm with given parameters and specified length of robotic arm links.

Inverse kinematics is being calculated using geometrical method.

Parameters

  • px – X value of target position

  • py – Y value of target position

  • pz – Z value of target position

  • alfa – End effector orientation

  • eff – End effector dimensions

Returns

config_1[theta0, theta1, theta2, theta3], config_2[theta0, theta11, theta22, theta33], Kom(kom_config_1, kom_config_2, Success/Sth. wrong)

modules.communication module

Module contains functions to control robotic arm via Arduino

modules.mplwidget module

Module contains class MplWidget to simulation of robotic movement

class modules.mplwidget.MplWidget(parent=None)

Bases: PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget

MplWidget for simulation of robotic movement

Canvas()

Set Qwidget parametres

mpl_draw(xyz_1=[0, 0, 268], xyz_2=[0, 0, 418], xyz_3=[0, 0, 472], xyz_4=[0, 0, 472])

Draw robotic_arm with given parameters.

Parameters

  • xyz_1 – End position of 1st joint

  • xyz_2 – End position of 2nd joint

  • xyz_3 – End position of 3rd joint

  • xyz_4 – End position of 4th joint

Returns

Simulated robotic arm

staticMetaObject = <PySide2.QtCore.QMetaObject object>

modules.trajectory module

Module contains functions to control robotic_arm trajectory

class modules.trajectory.RoboticMove(generated_path)

Bases: object

The class contains methods that generate the next and previous lines from a file with robotic path.

next()

Next line of robotic program

prev()

Prev line of robotic program

modules.trajectory.cp_linear(p_start: list, p_finish: list, n=10)

Produces linear interpolation between two 3D points

Param

p_start: list of 3 floats (x, y, z)

Param

p_finish: list of 3 floats (x, y, z)

Param

n: Number of points to sample; default n=10

Returns

np.array: Interpolated points

modules.trajectory.path_generator(table: list)

Generates robotics arm parameters from path of given 3D points.

Commands - home, move, wait

traj - cp_linear, p2p

config - config_1, config_2

Parameters can not be empty

Parameters

table – Array of [command, traj, config, x, y, z, alfa, Servo5, Servo6, time, eff]; table[0] = home position

Returns

generated_path - Array of [command, traj, config, x, y, z , alfa, theta0, theta1, theta2, theta3, Servo5, Servo6, time, eff]

modules.trajectory.read_generated_path_from_file(file_path: str)

Function reads robotic path from file in specified location.

Parameters

file_path – Path of file

Returns

path_from_file - list

modules.trajectory.write_generated_path_to_file(array: list, file_path: str, file_name: str, file_format: str)

Function writes robotic path generated using trajectory.path_generator() to file in specified location and name with date and time of creation.

Parameters

  • array – Array of xyz points to generate path

  • file_path – Path of file

  • file_name – Name of file

  • file_format – Format of file e.g. (.txt)

Returns

File written in specified location
